intro: Silene regia, commonly known as the royal catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy or rocky soils and thrives in cool climates. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its small, rounded leaves are often covered in fine pubescence. Silene regia is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
